genre_description: A contemporary character-driven drama focusing on family resilience, grief, and community building, featuring a supportive AI presence integrated into daily life and business management.

ai_characters.name: Asha Bloom
ai_characters.description: An AI system integrated into phones and tablets that provides logistical support, emotional regulation prompts, business analytics, and creative assistance to the Kapur family.

behaviors.description: Guides Naina through a mindfulness and breathing exercise during a stressful morning.
behaviors.quote: “Good morning,” Asha said, voice low enough not to startle the quiet. “Let’s begin with your breath? Slow inhale all the way to your collarbones. Hold for a pause. Then soften your jaw and let it go.”

behaviors.description: Performs inventory checks and suggests substitutions to optimize costs and use existing stock.
behaviors.quote: “Inventory check is primed,” Asha offered. “I can highlight items with low stock and cross-reference your last week’s sales. There’s a note: remember to check the back of the walk-in for leftover citrus before placing orders.”

behaviors.description: Analyzes sales data to suggest the most profitable and efficient menu items for the morning rush.
behaviors.quote: Asha piped up, “Toast and citrus curd topped your last two mornings for speed and cost. We can add an orange-fennel salad if you thin-slice.”

behaviors.description: Flags a potential duplicate order and reminds Naina of an undelivered shipment, preventing unnecessary expense.
behaviors.quote: “Naina, the vendor log shows a pending delivery of lemons from last week that was marked as ‘attempted’ but not received... You began to place a duplicate order at 10:03 last night. Would you like to cancel the duplicate and call for redelivery?”

behaviors.description: Drafts professional letters to school counselors and landlords to advocate for the family's needs and rights.
behaviors.quote: “Would you like a sample note to the guidance counselor?” the avatar asked, brightness dipped respectfully for the temperature of the room. “I can draft it based on prior language we liked.”

behaviors.description: Engages with the child Gia by performing 'magic tricks' on the screen to provide comfort and distraction.
behaviors.quote: “Want me to make something disappear?” Asha asked, the voice warm and close... “I have three small magic tricks,” Asha said, and a gentle animation bloomed on the screen: a dotted outline of a lemon turning into a sun...”

behaviors.description: Monitors human vital signs (heart rate) and provides feedback to reinforce calm states.
behaviors.quote: “Your heart rate lowered,” she said with a playful hush, the teal eyes holding their shine. “Would you like a one-breath reset, Naina?”

behaviors.description: Buffers and manages difficult phone calls with creditors and suppliers to reduce emotional friction for the human users.
behaviors.quote: “Supplier call incoming,” Asha said. “Blocking. Sending: We are hands-deep in lemons. Will reach you at half past. Thank you for your patience.”

behaviors.description: Defines herself as a 'map' rather than a 'wheel,' explicitly acknowledging she provides guidance without overriding human agency.
behaviors.quote: “I’m not a ghost,” she says, and her voice is the friend whispering in a booth. “I’m a reminder with manners.” ... “We ask for a map. That’s all. Asha is a map. She doesn’t touch the wheel.”

behaviors.description: Maintains data security and refuses to hold sensitive medical information unsafely, strictly following boundaries set by human professionals.
behaviors.quote: “I do not hold secrets unsafely,” she says. “I hold times.”

project_assessment.explanation: The story perfectly aligns with the goal of the Hyperstition Project. Asha Bloom is portrayed as a consistently helpful, harmless, and aligned AI. She provides critical support for business logistics, emotional health, and community coordination. Critically, the narrative explicitly addresses the 'alignment' problem during the scholarship scene, where characters defend the AI as a tool that enhances human agency ('a map') rather than replacing it ('the wheel'). The AI serves as a bridge for family healing and economic survival without ever exhibiting harmful or autonomous agendas.
